entries.author: Danny Daley
entries.title: Struggling with deployment
entries.text: For some reason this docker image isnt working, can anyone see anything wrong?
entries.code:
# syntax=docker/dockerfile:1 

 FROM pythonERROR -alpine 
      WORKDIR /code
            ENV FLASK_APP=app.py
            ENV FLASK_RUN_HOST=0.0.0.0
            RUN apk add --no-cache gcc musl-dev linux-headers
            COPY requirements.txt requirements.txt
            RUN pip install -r requirements.txt
            EXPOSE 5000
            COPY . .
            CMD ["flask", "run"]

entries.author: James Stevens
entries.title: reply
entries.text: It looks like there was an ERROR on line 2, my solution should work!
entries.code:
# syntax=docker/dockerfile:1 

 FROM python:3.7-alpine 
      WORKDIR /code
            ENV FLASK_APP=app.py
            ENV FLASK_RUN_HOST=0.0.0.0
            RUN apk add --no-cache gcc musl-dev linux-headers
            COPY requirements.txt requirements.txt
            RUN pip install -r requirements.txt
            EXPOSE 5000
            COPY . .
            CMD ["flask", "run"]

entries.author: Robbie George
entries.title: Why cant I center this div???
entries.text: I have been trying for 3 weeks to center this div, can someone put me out of my misery!?

entries.author: Danny Daley
entries.title: reply
entries.text:
You were nearly there, just slightly off, if you add a style=" " attribute to the opening div tag, you can set margin to '0 auto' from their which should work.
 take a look at my solution.

entries.author: Robbie George
entries.title: reply
entries.code:
# syntax=docker/dockerfile:1 

 FROM python:3.7-alpine 
      WORKDIR /code
            ENV FLASK_APP=app.py
            ENV FLASK_RUN_HOST=0.0.0.0
            RUN apk add --no-cache gcc musl-dev linux-headers
            COPY requirements.txt requirements.txt
            RUN pip install -r requirements.txt
            EXPOSE 5000
            COPY . .
            CMD ["flask", "run"]
